original_email.subject: Question about MAPE
original_email.body: Hi, I got admitted to Cal Poly and I'm not sure if I need to take the MAPE. Can you help?

response:
Dear Student1,


Hi there, and congratulations on your admission to Cal Poly! I'm happy to help provide guidance on the Math Placement Exam (MAPE) process.

After accepting your admission offer, you'll need to complete the Math Placement Survey via the link on your To-Do list in the MyCalPoly portal. This survey will determine your preliminary math placement based on your prior coursework and test scores. Once you complete the survey, check your email and To-Do list for next steps. You may be asked to:

- Send official test scores or transcripts to Cal Poly
- Take the MAPE exam, which can be done virtually through ProctorU until August 31st

The MAPE allows you to demonstrate readiness for math courses up to Calculus I (MATH 141). Be sure to take the MAPE by July 31st if possible, as this will ensure proper course placement before scheduling begins. If you have a qualifying AP Calculus score or have already completed a transferable calculus course, you may not need to take the MAPE. However, it's best to follow the specific instructions on your To-Do list after completing the survey.

Please let me know if you have any other questions! I'm here to help make the math placement process as smooth as possible.

I hope this information is helpful. If you have additional questions, please visit our math placement chatbot at https://math.calpoly.edu/reqs-exams

Best regards,
Cal Poly Math Placement Team
Mathematics Department

---
Original question from student1@example.com:
Hi, I got admitted to Cal Poly and I'm not sure if I need to take the MAPE. Can you help?

original_email.subject: AP Calc confusion
original_email.body: I took AP Calculus AB and got a 2. Do I still need to take the math placement test?

response:
Dear Student2,


Thank you for your question. Based on your score of 2 on the AP Calculus AB exam, you will need to take the Math Placement Exam (MAPE) to determine your appropriate first math course at Cal Poly. A score of 2 on the AP Calculus AB exam does not confer any course credit or eligibility for specific math courses. The MAPE is a diagnostic exam that can demonstrate your eligibility up to Calculus I (MATH 141). You can take the MAPE online through the proctoring service ProctorU at no cost until August 31st. Appointments must be scheduled at least 72 hours in advance. **Key Points:**
- A score of 2 on AP Calculus AB does not grant course credit or eligibility
- You need to take the MAPE to determine proper math placement
- The MAPE can be taken online through ProctorU until August 31st
- Schedule your MAPE appointment at least 72 hours in advance

I hope this information is helpful. If you have additional questions, please visit our math placement chatbot at https://math.calpoly.edu/reqs-exams

Best regards,
Cal Poly Math Placement Team
Mathematics Department

---

original_email.subject: MAPE location
original_email.body: Where do I take the MAPE if I'm out of state?

response:
Dear Student4,


Welcome to Cal Poly's math department! We're excited to have you join our community. As an out-of-state student, you have the option to take the Math Placement Exam (MAPE) virtually through ProctorU, our online proctoring service. This allows you to take the exam from the comfort of your own location without having to come to campus. Here are the key steps to take the virtual MAPE:

1. **Schedule your exam** at least 72 hours in advance on the ProctorU website. The virtual MAPE is available until August 31st, but we recommend taking it by July 31st to ensure course availability.

2. **Prepare** by reviewing the exam content and ensuring you meet the technical requirements for ProctorU.

3. **Take the exam** at your scheduled time through ProctorU's secure online platform. After you complete the MAPE, your results will determine which math course you are eligible to enroll in at Cal Poly. Our advisors will provide personalized guidance based on your placement. If you have any other questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to the math department.

I hope this information is helpful. If you have additional questions, please visit our math placement chatbot at https://math.calpoly.edu/reqs-exams

Best regards,
Cal Poly Math Placement Team
Mathematics Department

---
